author: Peter Wright
content:
Oh look! Lunch!
Balugas are opportunistic feeders and it was great that there was an inch of glass between them.

author: Doug Bostrom
content:
The “beluga container” at the Chicago aquarium is something to behold. It’s so large that the animals emerge from the transparency limit of the water (not shabby at all), approach the window appearing quite small because there’s nothing in the tank to set scale. When arriving at the window they loom ever so large, something that for some reason the video doesn’t quite capture.

Breathtaking.
